replies.bodyText:
Yes and no.... The original design intent was to keep the same pattern for local and synced Realms, so:
val localConfig = RealmConfiguration.Builder()....build()
val localRealm = Realm.getInstance(localConfig)

val syncConfig = SyncConfiguration.Builder(user, "partitionValue")....build()
val syncConfig = Realm.getInstance(syncConfig)

That doesn't really explain why these helper methods for creating the simple config are here though and if we do this, we should probably also add RealmConfiguration.defaultConfig() for symmetry.
Would it make sense to instead have?
val user = app.login(RealmCredentials.anonymous())
val syncConfig = user.defaultSyncConfiguration("partitionValue")

It might, but we wanted to move people away from having to go through users for configurations, which the above doesn't really do.
For this PR, I would like to keep them where they are...but it is definitely an area of the API we need to keep a close eye one.
